item.title: Linux Permission Management
item.description: Cheatsheet for Linux Permission Management Standard Permissions There are three basic permissions which are read, write and execute. And they can be granted to a specific user (so if you are not that user those permissions do not apply to you) a group of users (if you’re not a member of that group those permissions do not apply to you) to all other users (so if the first two do not apply - these are then the permissions you’ll have on the respective file/directory) This is also the order in which linux checks the permissions.
